summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Gloria Allred regarding travel arrangements for victims to attend a court conference on August 27, 2019, concerning the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The conference was scheduled by Judge Richard Berman.

connections.description: Allred is the attorney and Aldrich is her assistant, as indicated by the request for travel coordination to go through Aldrich.
Prosecutor Comey is corresponding with victim attorney Allred regarding logistical support for victims to attend a court proceeding.
Allred represents victims of Epstein in the legal proceedings concerning his indictment.
Comey, as an AUSA, was part of the prosecution team for the case against Epstein.

events.title: Court Conference on Dismissal of Epstein Indictment
events.description: Judge Richard Berman scheduled a conference to discuss the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. The order indicated victims would be allowed to be heard.

keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to discuss dismissing the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Judge Richard Berman's order allowed victims to be heard during the proceeding, either directly or through counsel.
The U.S. Attorney's Office, via AUSA Maurene Comey, offered to arrange and fund travel for victims who wished to attend the conference but could not afford it.
Attorney Gloria Allred confirmed she had three, possibly four, victims who wanted to travel to New York for the hearing and needed assistance.
The correspondence highlights official efforts to facilitate victim participation in a key posthumous legal proceeding related to the Epstein case.
